name: Josh Freese
description:
'''Joshua Ryan Freese''' (born December 25, 1972) is an American drummer. A member of [[punk rock]] band [[the Vandals]] since 1989, Freese has also been a member of [[New wave music|new wave]] band [[Devo]] since 1996. He was previously a member of hard rock band [[Guns N' Roses]] from 1997 to 1999, of [[Rock music|rock]] band [[Foo Fighters]] from 2023 to 2025 and a member of [[alternative rock]] band [[A Perfect Circle]] from 1999 to 2012, the latter of which he rejoined in 2024.

A prolific [[Session musician|session]] and touring drummer, Freese has appeared on over 400 albums since 1986 and performed live with artists including [[Nine Inch Nails]], [[Weezer]], [[Sublime with Rome]], [[Sting (musician)|Sting]], [[311 (band)|311]], [[100 gecs]], [[the Offspring]] and [[Danny Elfman]]. His considerable workload has earned him "the pristine reputation as one of the most in-demand session drummers in the business," according to [[Variety (magazine)|''Variety'']], while Freese jokingly dubbed himself "the blue collar freelance drummer to the stars."
